Governor Dinwiddie in Virginia that the French were building forts along the principal rivers of the upper Ohio Basin, he was advised to build English forts on the Ohio River and send a mission to determine whether the French were intruding on English soil. The French & Indian War, which broke out in 1755, further intensified these territorial disputes, with both sides vying for control of the lands along the Mississippi River.
